entry.def: If you thump something, you hit it hard, usually with your fist.

example.ex: He thumped my shoulder affectionately, nearly knocking me over...
example.tran: 他亲热地捶了一下我的肩膀，差点把我打倒。

example.ex: I heard you thumping on the door.

entry.def: If you thump someone, you attack them and hit them with your fist.

example.ex: Don't say it serves me right or I'll thump you.
example.tran: 别说我活该，不然让你尝尝我的拳头。

entry.tran: 重重地摔出;沉闷地撞击
entry.def: If you thump something somewhere or if it thumps there, it makes a loud, dull sound by hitting something else.

example.ex: She thumped her hand on the witness box...
example.tran: 她抬手重重地砸在证人席上。

example.ex: Waiters went scurrying down the aisles, thumping down tureens of soup.
example.tran: 服务员们匆匆忙忙穿过走道，把一盆盆汤重重地放在桌上。

entry.def: When your heart thumps, it beats strongly and quickly, usually because you are afraid or excited.

example.ex: My heart was thumping wildly but I didn't let my face show any emotion.
example.tran: 我的心在狂跳不已，但是我仍面不改色。

means.word_mean: 1. a heavy dull sound (as made by impact of heavy objects)
2. a heavy blow with the hand

sentences.sentence: "the knocker thudded against the front door"

means.word_mean: 3. hit hard with the hand, fist, or some heavy instrument;

example.en: On Sundays many church-goers listen to the priest to Bible-Uiuinp al church.
example.zh: 礼拜日有许多做礼拜的人在教堂聆听牧师讲道。

jushi.chinese: 那个恶棍在我头上重重一击。
